text: Good night, Sweetheart.

Sleep tight, Kiddo! The bedroom light CLICKS off. Soft moonlight illuminates room. A little boy snuggles into bed as his parents’ footsteps fade away down the hall. All is quiet. The closet door CREAKS open. The boy looks around the roo nervously, eyes growing wide. Suddenly, he spies a TENTAC emerging from the closet. The boy turns away in fear, but second look reveals it to be just a SHIRT SLEEVE. He rela back into bed. A DARK SHADOW cuts across the bedspread. From under the b a pair of EVIL RED EYES peer out. Rising up behind the boy, preparing to scare his young victim, towers a FEARSOME MONSTER. The boy sees the monster and SCREAMS. The monster, horrified by the child, lets out an even mor blood curdling SCREAM of his own. He backs away and slips on a soccer ball, which ricochets the wall and beans him squarely on the face. He stumbles back onto a skateboard, slips, and lands on a pile of JAC Crazed with pain, the monster runs around the room, SQUEA and holding his backside.

Simulation terminated. Simulation terminated. Worklights flash on, flooding the room with light. The bo now revealed to be an ANIMATRONTIC, winds down and resets One wall of the bedroom starts to rise, revealing...
The bedroom is a set, a simulator where monsters practice their scare tactics. Behind a control console sits an evaluator, the dragon-l MS. FLINT. Judging by her tone, she’s been through this before.
(to our monster) Alright, Mr... Bile, is it?
Uh, my friends call me Phlegm.

I fell down?

(frustrated) Let’s take a look at the tape. Here we go. Plint rewinds the tape, then plays it. ON THE MONITOR: Bile sneaks into the bedroom, leaving the door open. The image freezes. FLINT (cont’d) Right... there! See? The door. You left it wide open.
Oooh.
And leaving a door open is the worst mistake any employee can make because...?
Um... it could... let in a draft?
